zone.line: history and the never ending feelings and
remembrances arising from it is known
to no living soul. There was too deep
a horror in my tale for confidence; I
was on earth the sole depository of my
own secret. I might tell it to the winds
and to the desart heaths but I must
never among my fellow creatures, either
by word or look give allowance to the
smallest conjecture concerning of the
dread reality: I must shrink before
the eye of man lest he should read

must be silent lest my faltering
voice should betray unimagined horrors.

I must heap an impenetrable heap
of false smiles and words: cunning frauds,
treacherous laughter and a mixture
